intro: Castanea endicottii, commonly known as the Endicott chestnut, is a species of deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and other chestnut species. The tree produces edible nuts enclosed in a spiny husk, similar to other chestnuts. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges. Castanea endicottii typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can reach heights of up to 20 meters.
